replies.bodyText: I think this is for no operation that simulates the idle time.
replies.author: yanxinyi

replies.bodyText: @ChinmaySKulkarni This holds the idle time to be used for waiting. Modeled it as an operation, thus follows the same pattern as other operations.
replies.author: jpisaac

replies.bodyText: Can we rename it so it reflects an operation aimed at injecting "idle/wait time"?
replies.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

replies.bodyText: Ping @jpisaac I think we should still consider renaming the class so it is clear that it is introduced for the sole purpose of adding wait time. Maybe call it IdleOp
replies.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

+
+    // We should deprecate the RulesApplier(XMLConfigParser parser) constructor,

+    // it implies that the rules apply to all the data models the parser holds
+    // which can be confusing to the user of this class.
+    //
 
     public RulesApplier(DataModel model) {
         this(model, EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTimeMillis());

timeline.bodyText: nit: Extract some of these steps into their own methods? This will make unit testing easier too.
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: Can we break this method up too instead of putting it all in the constructor itself?
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: nit: Might be worth refactoring all these anonymous classes
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: Are we doing this TODO?
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: Use try-with-resources instead
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: Can you explain what you mean by 'dynamic statements' and do we want to uncomment/remove this?
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: nit: Logger.error(String, e) should be sufficient
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: nit: You can use Closables.closeQuietly() for these
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: We call commit() later anyways. Is setting this necessary? In case we run UPSERT SELECTS or DELETES with auto-commit, that will change the execution (client side vs server side) and this might be undesirable.
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: Log instead
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: Use try-with-resources.
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: Might be better to just let the outer catch block catch the exception since you're rethrowing it anyways. And then we can log there.
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: Can you create a Jira for this and link that in the TODO so we keep track of it?
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: nit: Interface name probably shouldn't end with Impl
timeline.author: ChinmaySKulkarni

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't operationStats really be different per Operation? Operation is an interface whereas this is a concrete class. Each operation type might have their own stats, no? Maybe make this an abstract class instead and have each operation type implement their own stats which extend this?
